metadata.title: CVE-2023-44981 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key vulnerability in ApacheZooKeeper. If SASL Quorum Peer authentication is enabled in ZooKeeper(quorum.auth.enableSasl=true), the authorization is done by verifying thatthe instance part in SASL authentication ID is listed in zoo.cfg serverlist. The instance part in SASL auth ID is optional and if it's missing,like 'eve@EXAMPLE.COM', the authorization check will be skipped. As aresult an arbitrary endpoint could join the cluster and begin propagatingcounterfeit changes to the leader, essentially giving it completeread-write access to the data tree. Quorum Peer authentication is notenabled by default. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.9.1,3.8.3, 3.7.2, which fixes the issue. Alternately ensure the ensembleelection/quorum communication is protected by a firewall as this willmitigate the issue. See the documentation for more details on correctcluster administration.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-44981` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzookeeper-java - 3.4.13-5ubuntu0.1
libzookeeper-mt2 - 3.4.13-5ubuntu0.1
libzookeeper-st2 - 3.4.13-5ubuntu0.1
python3-zookeeper - 3.4.13-5ubuntu0.1
zookeeper - 3.4.13-5ubuntu0.1
zookeeper-bin - 3.4.13-5ubuntu0.1
zookeeperd - 3.4.13-5ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zookeeper package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.13-5ubuntu0.1').
